title.narrative: Women in Action for Peace Building - phase 2

description.narrative: Analysis of the final version of the Peace Agreement; design of a training methodology for the follow-up on the implementation of the Peace Agreement; realisation of training workshops with women on the Special Jurisdiction for Peace; elaboration of a handbook for women leaders to monitor the verification of peace agreements in their respective regions; documentation of cases of sexual violence and presentation of these cases to the transitional justice mechanisms provided by the Peace Agreement; advocacy towards the Colombian Congress in the framework of the fast track mechanism adopted to pass laws in accordance with the dispositions of the Peace Agreement; publication of articles on progress and setbacks on women's rights and women victims' access to truth and justice; design of a measuring tool on the implementation of the Peace Agreement from a gender perspective; organisation of a meeting with experts on feminist theology; realisation of a national workshop to strengthen women's response to the discourse around the so-called "gender ideology" of the Peace Agreement.

Through training sessions on the content of the Peace Agreements and the transitional justice mechanisms provided, the project aims to strengthen women's capacity to build local peace. The project will also allow to monitor compliance with truth, justice, reparation and non-repetition measures for women victims of sexual violence in the armed conflict, as well as to bring cases of sexual violence to the Special Jurisdiction for Peace and the Truth Commission. Finally, the project will address the impacts of the campaign led by conservative sectors against the gender perspective of the Peace Agreement.
